issues.description: The problem statement and UML expect Rideable.messageOnRide() to be a no-argument method returning a String (and the examples / Main usage call r.messageOnRide() with no parameters). However, the solution repository defines Rideable.messageOnRide(String equipment) (i.e. it requires a String parameter) and Pig/Seal implement that parameterized signature. This parameter mismatch means the solution's Rideable and implementations are incompatible with the problem description and the template Main usage; students following the specification or using the provided template Main would get compilation errors or be confused about the correct signature to implement.
issues.suggested_fix:
Make the Rideable interface and its implementations match the problem specification and template usage. Either:

1) Preferred: Change Rideable.messageOnRide(String equipment) to messageOnRide() (no parameters) in solution_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Rideable.java, and update Pig and Seal to implement public String messageOnRide() returning "Riding on [Animal Type] [name]" (no equipment). This aligns the solution with the UML, the problem text, and the template Main.

Or

2) If the intended design actually requires an equipment parameter, update the problem statement, UML, and template Main to document and call messageOnRide(String equipment) (and update examples accordingly).

issues.description: The problem statement and template expect a no-argument method messageOnRide() that returns a string like "Riding on [Animal Type] [name]" (UML and Part 2 instructions). The solution repository instead defines Rideable.messageOnRide(String equipment) (adds a parameter) and implements messageOnRide(String equipment) in Pig and Seal, returning strings that include the equipment ("Riding on ... with " + equipment). This is a signature and behavioral mismatch: students implementing the exercise as described (no-arg messageOnRide) will not match the solution's interface/method signatures, and template code that calls r.messageOnRide() (no args) would not compile against the solution's Rideable. This creates a significant mapping/confusion barrier between the problem requirements/template usage and the solution implementation.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the solution with the problem/template by removing the extra parameter: change Rideable.messageOnRide(String equipment) to messageOnRide() and update Pig and Seal to implement messageOnRide() returning exactly "Riding on [Animal Type] [name]" (e.g. "Riding on Pig Doodle"). Alternatively, if the equipment parameter is intended, update the problem statement and template Main to document and call messageOnRide(String) and specify the expected return format — but the recommended fix is to modify the solution to match the original no-argument specification.
